burlap.behavior.singleagent.vfa

Interface ParametricScalarFunction

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DifferentiableRF, DifferentiableStateActionValue, DifferentiableStateValue, DifferentiableVInit, ParametricScalarFunction.ParametricStateActionFunction, ParametricScalarFunction.ParametricStateFunction
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DiffVFRF, LinearDiffRFVInit, LinearFVVFA, LinearStateActionDifferentiableRF, LinearStateDifferentiableRF, LinearStateDiffVF, LinearVFA, VanillaDiffVinit

    public interface ParametricScalarFunction
    An interface for defining a parametric function that outputs a scalar values (double). This interface is often used for value function approximation implementations. This highest-level of the interface does not define the input domain, which is left to subclasses of this interface. For example, the ParametricScalarFunction.ParametricStateFunction operates on State inputs and the ParametricScalarFunction.ParametricStateActionFunction operates on State-AbstractGroundedAction inputs.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan.
